intro: Lycianthes repens, commonly known as the creeping tomato or ground cherry, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshade plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, round fruits that enclose a single seed, often resembling cherry tomatoes in appearance. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy, ovate leaves. Lycianthes repens is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and edible fruits.
